title: THINKING ABOUT MIXEDNESS AND MIXING: INTERNATIONAL AND INTERDISCIPLINARY DIALOGUE
abstractText:
The overall aim of the seminar series is to stimulate and take forward new agenda in thinking about mixedness and mixing - exploring aspects of life for people from 'mixed' racial and ethnic backgrounds and their families.

Four main objectives:

  1. Contribute to debates on aspects of mixedness and mixing on the basis of conceptual and analytic rigour, and connect these to anti-racist and equality debates.
  2. Bring together different international and disciplinary perspectives in this theoretical and research endeavour.
  3. Iterative international approach: to help develop UK-based understandings through bringing international perspectives to bear, and to help UK-based emergent and cross-disciplinary conceptual perspectives, and empirical contgext, to inform international debate.
  4. Discuss the possibilities for dialogue and application of concepts with policymakers and practitioners working in the fields of supporting mixed race people and their famiies, and race equality.
